snippet: Among the crowd were young people wearing bandages or casts after being wounded during an eight-hour assault on the Army Public School in December.
abstract: Students at Army Public School in Peshawar, Pakistan, return to school month after Taliban gunmen carried out massacre there that left 150 dead, at least 134 of them children; parents, teachers and students attend ceremony at school to remember fallen as Pakistani Army soldiers remain on guard outside due to fear that Taliban may attack again.

byline.contributor: Declan Walsh contributed reporting from London, and Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: Among the crowd were young people wearing bandages or casts after being wounded during an eight-hour assault on the Army Public School in December.

headline.main: Grief and Defiance in Pakistan as Survivors of Taliban Massacre Return to School
headline.print_headline: Grief and Defiance for Pakistan Massacre Survivors

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Army Public School and Degree College (Peshawar, Pakistan)
